snippet: Decades after Turkish forces invaded Cyprus in a dispute with Greece over the island, many communities have an uneasy peace, but the beach resort at Varosha is still closed off.
abstract: Famagusta Journal; abandoned seaside resort of Varosha in Cyprus, which was sealed off when Turkish forces invaded the country in 1974 during a dispute with Greece, has become a potent symbol of the seeming intractability of the conflict; unlike other Cypriot villages that were abandoned but have resettled, Varosha is kept like a petrified urban museum, enclosed, boarded up and frozen in time.
lead_paragraph: Decades after Turkish forces invaded Cyprus in a dispute with Greece over the island, many communities have an uneasy peace, but the beach resort at Varosha is still closed off.

headline.seo: Cyprus Resort, Varosha, Remains Sealed Off to Visitors
headline.main: On Cyprus Beach, Stubborn Relic of Conflict
headline.print_headline: On Cyprus Beach, Stubborn Relic of Conflict
